questions.title: When to Delete Information
questions.problemText:
The paragraph discusses how bees communicate through dance patterns to share location information about flowers.

Should the writer delete this sentence: <u>"Bees also produce honey, which has been va

questions.title: Avoid Wrong Answer Traps
questions.problemText:
The passage discusses Maria's career as a chef.

Should the writer add this sentence: <u>"Maria won first place in a regional cooking competition in 2018."</u>

questions.title: Only Consider What the Sentence Says
questions.problemText:
The passage discusses the economic impact of the new highway.

Should the writer add this sentence: <u>"The highway construction created 500 jobs."</u>

questions.title: Adding Information - Read Paragraph Twice
questions.problemText:
The following sentence discusses Dr. Martinez's research methods: <u>"She spent months analyzing data from thousands of patients across multiple hospitals."</u>

Should the writer add this sentence ab

questions.title: Transitional Words (However)
questions.problemText: I expected to pay over $100 for my new hiking boots<u>; however,</u> I found a sale and got them for half of the original price.

questions.title: Unnecessary Information (Crossing-Out Trick)
questions.problemText: Electric vehicles<u>, thousands of them,</u> already on the road in America, are one of the fastest growing industries in the world.

questions.title: Identifying Comma + FANBOYS
questions.problemText: The debate team took first place in California<u>, and then</u> won the grand prize for the entire nation.

questions.title: Unnecessary Information with Names
questions.problemText: Mr. Alvin<u> a very popular</u> teacher among the students cancelled the final exam.

questions.title: Pronoun References - Must Come After
questions.problemText: [1] Cancer occurs when cells undergo a DNA mutation and begin to replicate uncontrollably. [2] <u>Most mutations are "silent" mutations that have no tangible effects.</u> [3] These cancerous cells beg

questions.title: Bracketed Numbers - Read Carefully
questions.problemText: [1] Most Americans have never tried truly great chocolate. [2] Sure, we have Hershey's chocolate bars, which are delicious. [3] But have you ever had chocolate from Switzerland? [4] Take a real Swiss

questions.title: Chronological Order and Context
questions.problemText:
The writer wants to add the following sentence to the paragraph about Jackie Chan:

<u>"As a child, he had always loved the slapstick comedy of Buster Keaton and Charlie Chaplin."</u>

[1] When he was

questions.title: Topic Continuity - Group Related Ideas
questions.problemText: [1] Carnivorous pitcher plants have many symbiotic relationships in the animal kingdom. [2] Some have relationships with parasites and fungi. [3] However, only N. hemsleyana pitchers have acquired tra

questions.title: Countable vs. Non-countable
questions.problemText: The research showed that the <u>amount of students</u> participating in after-school programs has increased significantly.

questions.title: Prepositional Idioms
questions.problemText: The young child was afraid <u>by</u> the thunderstorm and hid under the bed.

questions.title: Have vs. Of
questions.problemText: If Sarah had studied more diligently, she <u>could of</u> earned a higher score on the exam.

questions.title: Active vs. Passive Voice
questions.problemText: The new policy <u>was announced by the principal</u> during the morning assembly.

questions.title: Affect vs. Effect
questions.problemText: The documentary explored the effect that social media has on teenagers, showing how constant connectivity <u>affects</u> their mental health and self-esteem.

questions.title: Than vs. Then
questions.problemText: The coach explained that winning requires more practice <u>than</u> natural talent alone can provide.

questions.title: Basic Misplaced Modifier
questions.problemText: <u>Consistently erupting, Jack</u> loves taking pictures of the Old Faithful geyser at Yellowstone National Park.

questions.title: Front Modifier with Multiple Nouns
questions.problemText: A brand new approach to automobile manufacturing, <u>Henry Ford and Ford Motor Company installed</u> the first moving assembly line in 1913.

questions.title: Middle/End Modifier with "which"
questions.problemText: The research team, <u>which arrived at their nesting grounds early this year,</u> tracked the movements of the blue storks.

questions.title: Modifier without Commas
questions.problemText: The dog <u>chasing the cat ran</u> into the street.

questions.title: Both/And Structure
questions.problemText: <u>Both a scholar and quite athletic,</u> Sylvia got a scholarship to row crew in college.

questions.title: Two-Item List Comparison
questions.problemText: I would rather <u>get free music with commercials than paying</u> for music with no commercials.

questions.title: Basic List Parallelism
questions.problemText: Theresa was expecting a visit from her mother, so she made her bed, <u>cleaning the shelves</u> of the refrigerator, and swept the kitchen floor.

questions.title: Not Only/But Also
questions.problemText: My mother not only took away my keys <u>but also she locked</u> them in the safe.

questions.title: Who vs. Whom in Descriptive Phrases
questions.problemText: I could not believe how much the florists <u>who</u> opened up a shop down the street charge for their roses.

questions.title: Possessive Pronouns with Group Nouns
questions.problemText: The entire team went on stage to pick up <u>their</u> trophy.

questions.title: Pronoun Agreement with Singular Antecedents
questions.problemText: Each member of the women's track team improved <u>their</u> time.

questions.title: Ambiguous Pronouns
questions.problemText: When the owner of Pizza Port greets a customer, <u>he</u> always smiles.

questions.title: Possessive vs. Plural Nouns
questions.problemText: As a young boy, Raheem became enthralled with pro soccer <u>player's and</u> their signature moves.

questions.title: Testing Semicolons Between Clauses
questions.problemText: Strawberries are supposed to be easy to grow<u>; however,</u> the ones in my garden die every year.

questions.title: Colon Introducing a List
questions.problemText: I have always found surfing difficult, but it can be broken down into three simple <u>steps paddle</u> hard, stand up, and ride the wave.

questions.title: Pair of Dashes for Unnecessary Information
questions.problemText: All of Tommy's favorite toys<u>, his toy cars, his</u> marbles, and his Legos - were lost during the move.

questions.title: Quotation Marks with Spoken Dialogue
questions.problemText: As the driver approached, the crossing guard said to <u>herself, "who</u> would buy a purple car?"

questions.title: Redundancy in Context
questions.problemText: After two years of traveling abroad, Jerome finally <u>returned back home</u> to his family in California.

questions.title: Eliminating Wordiness
questions.problemText: The committee met <u>at this point in time</u> to discuss the upcoming budget proposals.

questions.title: Removing Irrelevant Information
questions.problemText: The marathon runner crossed the finish line in first place. <u>Marathon running became an Olympic sport in 1896.</u> The crowd erupted in cheers as she raised her arms in victory.

questions.title: Identifying Question Type
questions.problemText:
The July 4th "Walk for Wags" event raised over $10,000 <u>this year for local dog shelters</u>.

Which choice is the least redundant in context?

questions.title: Reading for Context
questions.problemText:
The new restaurant received excellent reviews. <u>However,</u> the chef had trained at the finest culinary schools in France.

Which transition word is the most logical in context?

questions.title: All Transitions Type
questions.problemText:
From a distance, the ocean looked pretty calm today even though a storm had arrived last night. <u>Under the circumstances,</u> the scene was much more chaotic with big waves and strong riptides.

Whi

questions.title: No Transition Option
questions.problemText: Stepping out on the island's port on Monday, the new couple debuted their own classic take on beach attire. <u>As a result,</u> the actor opted for a classic white tee and board shorts while his model

questions.title: Transition Categories
questions.problemText:
The study showed that exercise improves cardiovascular health. <u>For instance,</u> regular exercise can reduce the risk of heart disease by up to 35%.

Which transition word is the most logical in co

questions.title: Irregular Verbs - "a" vs. "u" Rule
questions.problemText: Before I woke up, Chris had already <u>swam</u> twenty laps.

questions.title: Identifying Subject-Verb Agreement vs. Tense Questions
questions.problemText: The first row of the townhouses for sale in my neighborhood <u>has</u> the best view of the beach.

questions.title: Subject-Verb Agreement with Prepositional Phrases
questions.problemText: The stable hand hired by the farm owners <u>groom</u> the horses every morning.

questions.title: Verb Tense Matching Context
questions.problemText: The car accident on the freeway delayed my commute and <u>causes</u> me to be late for the job interview.

questions.title: Specific Description
questions.problemText:
Before refrigerators, Americans kept food cold in <u>iceboxes, which required ice to be bought and placed into the box each week</u>.

Which choice most specifically describes what was used to build i

questions.title: Don't Overthink It
questions.problemText:
The scientist discovered <u>a new species of butterfly in the rainforest</u>.

Which choice provides the most relevant detail about where in the rainforest the discovery was made?

questions.title: Just Answer What's Asked
questions.problemText:
The concert was <u>loud and energetic</u>.

Which choice best conveys the overwhelming intensity of the concert experience?

questions.title: Emphasis Question
questions.problemText:
Harold always begged for grow-in-water dinosaurs that <u>sprawl</u> when placed into water.

Which choice most clearly emphasizes how the dinosaurs increase in size?

questions.title: Similar Meanings, Different Uses
questions.problemText:
The officials must be <u>dispassionate about</u> the outcome of the game in order to do their jobs properly.

Which choice is clearest and most precise in context?

questions.title: Testing Each Word
questions.problemText:
After reading my paper, my teacher was <u>adamant</u> that I needed to learn how to properly cite my sources.

Which choice is clearest and most precise in context?

questions.title: Using Known Words
questions.problemText:
When I first moved in, the passing train woke me up every night. However, I can now just <u>tune it out</u> and sleep through the entire night.

Which choice is clearest and most precise in context?

questions.title: Identifying Context
questions.problemText:
The documentary <u>exhibited</u> rare footage of the endangered species in its natural habitat.

Which choice is clearest and most precise in context?
